name: Hairy Jewel Orchid
description: Goodyera hispida, commonly known as Hairy Jewel Orchid, is a terrestrial orchid native to tropical regions of Asia, particularly India, China, and Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and features creeping stems (10-20 cm long) with small, dramatic, oval-shaped, dark green leaves with distinctive intricate vein patterns and hairy surfaces. The plant displays a creeping growth habit. Prized more for their beautiful leaves than flowers, unlike most orchids. The intricate vein patterns on leaves resemble precious metalwork, with some species having iridescent or metallic-looking patterns. In its native habitat, it grows in moist, shaded areas of tropical forests. In terrariums or indoor settings, this plant adds exotic elegance with its stunning veined foliage and unique growth habit. It's popular among orchid enthusiasts for its attractive veined foliage.
careTips: Water when media begins to dry
Bright indirect light - avoid direct sun
Feed with orchid fertilizer during growing season
